thread.title: Chrissy Teigen Discusses Her Diaper Problem in a Ridiculously Cute, Relatable Instagram Post
thread.title_full: Chrissy Teigen Discusses Her Diaper Problem in a Ridiculously Cute, Relatable Instagram Post

author: maressabrown
title: Chrissy Teigen Discusses Her Diaper Problem in a Ridiculously Cute, Relatable Instagram Post
text:
Chrissy Teigen Discusses Her Diaper Problem in a Ridiculously Cute, Relatable Instagram Post Chrissy Teigen Discusses Her Diaper Problem in a Ridiculously Cute, Relatable Instagram Post 
Along with a new photo of baby Luna, the Sports Illustrated model shared a frustration moms just can't avoid! By Maressa Brown Comments 
Rick Kern/Getty Images Chrissy Teigen is a rock star when it comes to getting real about love, life, current events, pregnancy, and of course, motherhood. She's a celebrity mom who has no shame telling it like it is when it comes to anything from stretch marks to pregancy boobs . Just. Love. Her! In Teigen's latest Instagram post , she has done it again, summing up a reality of parenthood many moms can relate to. Today, the model and Lip-Sync Battle co-host posted a photo of Luna , her 10-month-old daughter with husband John Legend, looking as adorable as ever, writing, "This diaper is never not blue so don't even start with me." 
Check it out, and try not to do your best impression of the "face with tears of joy" emoji. A post shared by chrissy teigen (@chrissyteigen) on Feb 19, 2017 at 10:32am PST New parent? Sign up for our Parents Daily Babies newsletter 
When your baby is that cute, can you really be annoyed? Well, yes, definitely! The good news is that, according to the American Pregnancy Association , babies urinate approximately 20 times a day for the first several months of their lives, so it would obviously be tough (and pricey!) to be changing your kiddo's diaper every time they wet themselves. The APA's rule of thumb is to change them every two to three hours. But, sure, that's still a lot of diaper-changing! 9 Reasons Chrissy Teigen Is Totally Nailing Parenting 
Thank goodness for Teigen telling it like it is and letting other moms know that if they too find themselves maddened by that perpetually blue line, they are so not alone.
